    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        main method calls the admin method, the leagueCheckMethod and teamsSetUp method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • adminLogin

        public static java.lang.String adminLogin​()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        adminLogin method shows an input dialog box on the screen asking for the user id and password of the admin. if either of these don't match the text file with the admin id an error message will be displayed and the admin has 2 more attempts.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • leagueCheck

        public static void leagueCheck​(java.lang.String adminID)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        leagueCheck method calls the leagueScan method which scans the league text file. Then goes through the array list with the leagues and checks if the admin id matches the leagues. It then calls the leagueSetUp with the adminID and their leagues
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • leagueSetUp

        public static void leagueSetUp​(java.lang.String[] thisAdminsLeagues,
                               java.lang.String adminID)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        league set up gives the user the option of editing an existing league or creating a new one. If you choose to create a new league it allows you to choose the type of sport or input a new one. It calls the getRuleForASport method if you choose one of the existing sports. If you create a new sport it calls sportSetUp method. Editing an existing league will give the user options of their existing leagues to edit. And from there you can either delete the league, or edit the league configuration
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteLeague

        public static void deleteLeague​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> leagues)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method gives the admin the option to delete one of their leagues. after it deletes the league the programme exits.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sportSetUp

        public static java.lang.String sportSetUp​(int sportCount,
                                          java.lang.String[] sportsNames)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        sportSetUp method allows admin to set up a sport of their choice. It checks whether that sport name already exists. They can add their own points for a win, lose or draw and can choose whether or not there's away games.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getRuleForASport

        public static void getRuleForASport​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> rules,
                                    java.lang.String sportName)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        It reads the rules (winPoints,drawPoints,lossPoints,awayGames) for the sport the user selects.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • teamsSetUp

        public static void teamsSetUp​(java.lang.String leagueName)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        the admin can input the names of their teams and the method calls the scanTeams method to make sure they don't already exists. They can then finish adding teams when there's a minimum of two teams. the method then calls the fixtureGenerationMethod which generate the fixtures.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • fixtureGeneration

        public static void fixtureGeneration​(java.lang.String leagueName,
                                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> teams)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This method generates the fixtures for the league and writes them to a text file. it then calls the diplayFixtures method to output fixtures on screen.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • displayFixtures

        public static void displayFixtures​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> fixtures,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> teams,
                                   int matchesPerRound)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        This method displays allows the admin to choose if they would like to view the fixtures and if so which round. when they choose a round it displays the fixures for that round. When the admin selects that they are finished viewing fixtures, it calls the displayResults method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • displayResults

        public static void displayResults​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> fixtures,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> teams,
                                  int matchesPerRound)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        displayResults gives the admin the option of viewing the results if the results of that league have been previously entered. if they would like to view them they can choose which round they would like to view.it then calls the editResults method when the admin is finished viewing the results.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • editResults

        public static void editResults​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> fixtures,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> results,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> teams)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        The admin can choose if they would like to edit the results of the fixture. they can then enter the scores scored by both the home team and away team. then it calls the resultsCalculator method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • resultsCalculator

        public static void resultsCalculator​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> fixtures,
                                     java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> results,
                                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> teams)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Sequentially scans through the results and calculates which team won or lost or if they drew, and then updates that teams score/gd etc. It then calls the orderLeaderBoard method
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • orderLeaderboard

        public static void orderLeaderboard​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> resultsCalculations,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> teams)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Orders the the unorderedLeaderboard based on Total points > Goal Difference > Alphabetical Order Then it calls the scanLeaderboard() method
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • displayLeaderBoard

        public static void displayLeaderBoard​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> leaderboard)
        prints the leader board on the screen in an ordered way so people can read and understand it. (For an unknown reason it doesn't display the data correctly on the JOptionPane but does on the console screen)

        java.io.IOException

        resultsScanner scans through the results text file and inputs it into an arraylist it the returns results.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • scanUnorderedLeaderboard

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> scanUnorderedLeaderboard​(java.lang.String leagueName)
                                                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Scans through the unordered leadboard text file and enters it into an arraylist. Then it returns this arraylist
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • scanLeaderboard

        public static void scanLeaderboard​(java.lang.String leagueName)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        This method scans the leader board text file and inputs it into an arraylist. it then calls the displayLeaderBoard method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
